titleStmt.title: An elegy on the unfortunate, though glorious deaths, of that most noble Prince and famous general Frederick Duke of Schomberg, and the reverend and truly valiant Dr. George Walker, who were both unhappily slain at the battle of Duleek, near Dublin in Ireland, which was fought on the first of this instant July.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for T. Clark in Little Britain,

notesStmt.note: Date of publication suggested by Wing (2nd ed.).
Reproduction of original in: Harvard University. Library.
